svg.style: background: transparent; background-color: transparent; color-scheme: light dark;

path.style: fill: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255)); stroke: light-dark(rgb(0, 0, 0), rgb(255, 255, 255));

div.span: This tells the system to go to the very top of the hierarchy (the Root, apsolute path). On window: -A
followed by a colon and slash (e.g.,

Relative on linux Starts with anything else (letters, ., or ..). This tells the system to start looking from the folder where the program is currently running and on window starts with the folder name or ./ or ../ also

li.p: In your editor: You see two characters: \ (the backslash) and n (the letter).
In the computer's memory: It is stored as a single numeric value (ASCII or Unicode). For example, \n is stored as the number 10.

switch.text: In your editor: You see two characters: \ (...

div.p: The compiler/interpreter sees the \ (called the escape character) and treats the next character(s) as a special instruction — not as literal text.

switch.text: The compiler/interpreter sees...

a.text: Text is not SVG - cannot display
